oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Enhancing the effective energy barrier of a Dy(III) SMM using a bridged diamagnetic Zn(II) ion
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: UPADHYAY, A
SINGH, SK
DAS, C
MONDOL, R
LANGLEY, SK
MURRAY, KS
RAJARAMAN, G
SHANMUGAM, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SINGLE-MOLECULE MAGNETS
LANTHANIDE COMPLEXES
LOW-SYMMETRY
DY-III
ANISOTROPY BARRIER
LIGAND
TETRANUCLEAR
LUMINESCENT
RELAXATION
MAGNETIZATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Field induced single-molecule-magnet behaviour is observed for both a heterodinuclear [ZnDy(L-)(2)](3+) complex (1) and a mononuclear [Dy(HL)(2)](3+) complex (2), with effective energy barriers of 83 cm(-1) and 16 cm(-1), respectively. Insights into the relaxation mechanism(s) and barrier heights are provided via ab initio and DFT calculations. Our findings reveal an interesting observation that the U-eff of SMMs can be enhanced by incorporating diamagnetic metal ions.
